Meteorology-Climatology.1: Be able to understand the thermodynamics, forces responsible for atmospheric motion, and the interactions of radiation in the atmosphere and with the Earth's surface.
Meteorology-Climatology.2: Be able to understand and apply appropriate mathematical, statistical, and computer programming techniques and methods necessary to solve problems in the atmospheric sciences.
Meteorology-Climatology.3: Be able to synthesize a broad understanding of the basic processes of the atmosphere to generate shirt and long term predictions of weather and climate.
Meteorology-Climatology.4: Be able to understand the principles of sensor characteristics and sources of error; use relevant radar, satellite, and surface instrumentation; interpret and evaluate data needed to understand basic concepts, conduct research, and make forecasts.
Meteorology-Climatology.5: Be able to understand how the atmosphere interacts with other components of the Earth System to exchange matter and energy on short and long timescales.
